thread.title: UXC could still see a superior offer: Patersons analyst
thread.title_full: UXC could still see a superior offer: Patersons analyst | afr.com

author: afr.com
title: UXC could still see a superior offer: Patersons analyst
text:
UXC managing director Cris Nicolli said CSC's offer recognised the value in UXC and would create a regional tech giant. Paul Jones by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Patersons Securities analyst Ben Kakoschke notes that while UXC has indicated its support for the proposed transaction and has agreed not to solicit any competing transactions, "there is always the possibility of a superior offer being flushed out."
US technology services giant Computer Sciences Corporation has confirmed that it is poised to buy Australia's biggest listed tech services group UXC, in a deal that will be worth $428 million, as exclusively revealed by Street Talk on Tuesday.
"The indicative proposal represents a 33 per cent premium to the 120-day volume weighted average price and a 7 premium to our 12-month price target of $1.20 a share," Kakoschke said in a research note to clients.
"However, we note that it is below the last traded price of $1.33 a share. Consequently, we are changing our recommendation to "under review" from "buy" as the company enters a five-week period of exclusive due diligence."
Meanwhile, Phillip Capital's James Wilson says the "low-ball" bid is good for the IT sector, and recommends buying UXC and ASG Group.
Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Allens advised Computer Sciences Corporation while Nomura and Freehills worked for UXC.
